title: Wupatki National Monument: Weather
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors     Weather                Weather         Storm over the desert. NPS photo by Dallas Larsen.  Wupatki is high desert; at elevations of 4,280’ to 5,720’, weather conditions can be unpredictable. In general, here’s what you can expect: Summer: Dry and windy. Brief daily thunderstorms from July-September provide most of Wupatki’s annual 8” of precipitation. Daytime temperatures are in the 90s and occasionally over 100° F. Lows are normally in the 50s.  Fall: Very pleasant, with mild to warm daytime temperatures, some precipitation, and light winds. Winter: Mostly mild daytime temperatures, and nights often below freezing. A few small snow showers. Spring: Unpredictable, and often windy. Mild to warm days, but occasional rain or small snow showers.
